cold_snaps.status: At present, there is no cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps occur annually.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 13.04mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional precipitation event and ranked 8th out of our records.  A rate of 8.6mm per hour was recorded during the 7.9 hour long storm.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 27.0mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked highest from our records.  The precipitation lasted 2.0 hours and dumped 7.99mm in total.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting so far started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 5th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 74.47 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.9°C) and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.9 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1545 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 713m to 1594m and averaged 1114.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, occasional overcast conditions, and a mix of sun and clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
